column3: Concept ACK. As I understand it `is` should only be used to check for "pointer-equality" and IIRC the only built-in type where that is acceptable (and maybe recommended) to use is `None`.\n\nDid you also check the functional test files and other python files in this repo for similar sharp edges?

> Concept ACK. As I understand it `is` should only be used to check for "pointer-equality"

'`is` is roughly equivalent to comparing pointers in C. As an implementation detail of CPython (not PyPy or others) `x is y` actually compares memory addresses, because on CPython `id(x)` returns the memory address of x.

> the only built-in type where that is acceptable (and maybe recommended) to u

No other files matching '*.py' exhibit this problem.

I also did a brief eyeball scan. Overall the Python scripts/modules look okay. A few suggestions

- contrib/seeds/generate-seeds.py
  - could use https://docs.python.org/3/library/argparse.html for argument handling
  - could probably use https://docs.python.org/3/library/ipaddress.html for IP parsing
- contrib/seeds/makeseeds.py
Post-merge ACK 47b49a05eafddcaef373f70436d794e9f9f7495c\n\nWarm welcome as a contributor @moreati! Thanks for reviewing the Python code in the repo.
